news.title: Disney posts mixed results as streaming growth is offset by legacy TV declines
news.summary: Disney reported fiscal fourth-quarter results before the bell Thursday. The company gave its final update on streaming subscriber metrics. The results are expected to be released later this week.

news.title: Cheaper medicines, free beach trips: U.S. health plans tap prescriptions that feds say are illegal
news.summary: AFPs promise to connect patients with more-affordable options for accessing specialty medications. There's a major catch. AFPs often come at very high costs.

news.title: TKO, Polymarket strike multiyear deal to integrate prediction markets into UFC events
news.summary: The deal makes UFC and Zuffa Boxing the first sports organizations to incorporate prediction market technology into live events. The deal is expected to be in place by the end of 2015.

news.title: Trump signs funding bill, ends government shutdown
news.summary: Most Democrats opposed the funding bill because it does not include extending enhanced ACA tax credits. Most Democrats, who are in the minority in Congress, opposed the bill.

news.title: Joby Aviation wraps up first military aircraft test flight with partner L3Harris
news.summary: The hybrid aircraft, with piloted and autonomous capabilities, ties into a broader move by the Trump administration to advance U.S. military technology.

news.title: JD.com’s stock jumps as Chinese e-commerce giant triumphs over low expectations
news.summary: Third-quarter earnings were way below the corresponding period for 2024. More important was that the company beat relatively conservative analyst predictions. The company's third-quarter results were way lower than expected.

news.title: Streaming gains a bright spot for Walt Disney in an otherwise mixed earnings report
news.summary: The Walt Disney Co. had a difficult quarter with the fallout from pulling Jimmy Kimmel off the air, its fight with YouTube and switching gears with its betting partner at ESPN.

news.title: Here’s an unexpected twist that could throw the stock-market rally off course next year
news.summary: Investors are not considering the risk that the economy poses to the stock market rally, warns Nomura’s Charlie McElligott.

news.title: My brother is the trustee of our parents’ $10 million estate. He’s threatened to bleed the estate dry. What now?
news.summary: “He is paying himself $40 per hour or $1,600 per week to manage the estate,” a source says. “He’s paying himself more than $40,000 per week,’ the source adds.

news.title: My late husband’s son is listed as beneficiary on his IRAs. Where does that leave me?
news.summary: “My husband’s son said he doesn’t want any part of the IRAs or the insurance policies,” she said.
